text: How is personal data collected by your system?

options.label: Direct user input
options.description: Users manually provide data through forms or prompts

options.label: Automated collection
options.description: System automatically collects data (cookies, tracking, sensors)

options.label: Third-party sources
options.description: Data obtained from external providers or partners

options.label: Public sources
options.description: Data scraped or collected from publicly available sources

options.label: Inferred/derived
options.description: Data generated by the system based on other data (profiles, predictions)

regulatoryRelevance: Collection method determines transparency obligations under GDPR Articles 13-14 and consent requirements across jurisdictions.

text: How long is personal data retained by your system?

options.label: Session only
options.description: Data is deleted when the session ends

options.label: Up to 30 days
options.description: Data is retained for up to 30 days

options.label: Up to 1 year
options.description: Data is retained for up to 1 year

options.label: Indefinite
options.description: Data is retained indefinitely or until deletion is requested

options.label: Custom retention policy
options.description: Varies based on data type or other criteria

regulatoryRelevance: GDPR Article 5(1)(e) requires storage limitation. Retention periods must be justified and documented in DPIAs.

text: Is personal data shared with third parties (including sub-processors, analytics providers, or AI model providers)?
regulatoryRelevance: Third-party data sharing triggers GDPR data processing agreements, CCPA service provider requirements, and cross-border transfer obligations.

text: What legal basis or consent mechanism is in place for data collection and processing?

options.label: Explicit consent
options.description: Users affirmatively opt in to data collection

options.label: Implied consent
options.description: Consent implied through continued use

options.label: Contract necessity
options.description: Processing is necessary for a contract with the user

options.label: Legitimate interest
options.description: Processing is based on legitimate business interest

options.label: Legal obligation
options.description: Processing required by law

options.label: Not yet determined
options.description: Legal basis has not been established

regulatoryRelevance: GDPR Article 6 requires a valid legal basis. Sensitive data requires explicit consent under Article 9. LGPD has similar requirements.

text: Does personal data transfer across international borders?
regulatoryRelevance: GDPR Articles 44-49 restrict transfers outside the EU/EEA. Similar restrictions exist under UK GDPR, LGPD, and Singapore PDPA.

text: What mechanisms exist for individuals to exercise their data rights? Select all that are currently implemented.

options.label: Right of access
options.description: Users can request a copy of their data

options.label: Right to correction
options.description: Users can correct inaccurate data

options.label: Right to deletion
options.description: Users can request data be deleted

options.label: Right to portability
options.description: Users can receive their data in a portable format

options.label: Right to object
options.description: Users can object to certain processing activities

options.label: Opt-out of sale/sharing
options.description: Users can opt out of data sale or sharing

options.label: None implemented
options.description: No data subject rights mechanisms are currently in place

regulatoryRelevance: GDPR Articles 12-23 grant comprehensive data subject rights. CCPA/CPRA provides rights to know, delete, and opt out. Mechanisms must be accessible and responsive within legal timeframes.
